Package ohos.distributedschedule.interwork

Class DeviceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.distributedschedule.interwork.DeviceManager

  • public class DeviceManager
extends Object
    Provides methods for managing devices on the distributed network, including registering and unregistering callbacks for notifications of device online and offline, obtaining information about all remote devices or a specified remote device, querying information about an remote application based on a specified Intent, and initializing the distributed execution framework for a device.

    If your application needs to be notified when a device on the distributed network becomes online or offline, call DeviceManager#registerDeviceStateCallback(IDeviceStateCallback) to register device state callbacks. If such notifications are no longer required, call DeviceManager#unregisterDeviceStateCallback(IDeviceStateCallback) to unregister these callbacks.

    To obtain information about all remote devices on the distributed network, call DeviceManager#getDeviceList(int). To obtain information about a specified remote device, call DeviceManager#getDeviceInfo(String).

    To query information about a non-HarmonyOS remote application on the distributed network, call DeviceManager#queryRemoteAbilityByIntent(Intent).

    If your application needs to invoke a component of a non-HarmonyOS application installed on a remote device, call DeviceManager#initDistributedEnvironment(String, IInitCallback) to initialize the distributed execution framework. In this way, your application will be notified of the initialization result through the specified callback. After the cross-device task is complete, call DeviceManager#unInitDistributedEnvironment(String, IInitCallback) to deactivate the distributed execution framework and unregister the previously registered callbacks.

    Since:
    3
    See Also:
    IDeviceStateCallback, IInitCallback

    • Method Detail

      • registerDeviceStateCallback

        public static boolean registerDeviceStateCallback​(IDeviceStateCallback callback)
        Registers a custom device state callback so that the application can be notified upon state changes of devices on the distributed network.

        To register a callback for device state changes, you should first implement the IDeviceStateCallback interface and override the IDeviceStateCallback#onDeviceOnline(String, int) and IDeviceStateCallback#onDeviceOffline(String, int) methods. The two methods will be called upon device state changes.

        Do not repeatedly register the same device state callback for an application. Otherwise, the registration fails.

        Each process can register a maximum of 10 device state callbacks.

        To use this method, your application must have gained the ohos.permission.DISTRIBUTED_DEVICE_STATE_CHANGE permission.

        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback object to register. You must first implement the IDeviceStateCallback interface.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the registration is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have the required permissions.
        Since:
        3

      • unregisterDeviceStateCallback

        public static boolean unregisterDeviceStateCallback​(IDeviceStateCallback callback)
        Unregisters all custom device state callbacks previously registered through registerDeviceStateCallback(ohos.distributedschedule.interwork.IDeviceStateCallback).

        Generally, you first call registerDeviceStateCallback(ohos.distributedschedule.interwork.IDeviceStateCallback) to register device state callbacks and then call this method if your application no longer needs to receive any state change notifications. If this method is called on callbacks that are not registered, the unregistration fails.

        To use this method, your application must have gained the ohos.permission.DISTRIBUTED_DEVICE_STATE_CHANGE permission.

        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback object to unregister. You must first implement the IDeviceStateCallback interface.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the unregistration is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have the required permissions.
        Since:
        3

      • getDeviceList

        public static List<DeviceInfo> getDeviceList​(int flag)
        Obtains information about all remote devices on the distributed network.

        To use this method, your application must have gained the ohos.permission.GET_DISTRIBUTED_DEVICE_INFO permission.

        Parameters:
        flag - Indicates the flag used for querying specified devices. The value DeviceInfo#FLAG_GET_ALL_DEVICE means to query all online and offline devices on the distributed network; DeviceInfo#FLAG_GET_ONLINE_DEVICE means to query all online devices on the distributed network; and DeviceInfo#FLAG_GET_OFFLINE_DEVICE means to query all offline devices on the distributed network.
        Returns:
        Returns the list of all remote devices meeting the query criterion if any; returns an empty list if the query fails or no device is found.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have the required permissions.
        Since:
        3

      • getDeviceInfo

        public static DeviceInfo getDeviceInfo​(String deviceId)
        Obtains information about a specified remote device on the distributed network based on the given network ID.

        To use this method, your application must have gained the ohos.permission.GET_DISTRIBUTED_DEVICE_INFO permission.

        Parameters:
        deviceId - Indicates the network ID of the device.
        Returns:
        Returns information about the specified device if any; returns null if the query fails or the device is not found.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have the required permissions.
        Since:
        3

      • queryRemoteAbilityByIntent

        public static List<AbilityInfo> queryRemoteAbilityByIntent​(Intent intent)
        Queries information about a particular remote application on the current distributed network based on the specified Intent.

        You can use this method to query only non-HarmonyOS applications installed on remote devices.

        To use this method, your application must have gained the ohos.permission.GET_BUNDLE_INFO permission.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the Intent containing the bundle information and device network ID of the application to query.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of AbilityInfo objects for the desired application.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application does not have the required permission.
        Since:
        3

      • initDistributedEnvironment

        public static void initDistributedEnvironment​(String deviceId,
                                              IInitCallback callback)
                                       throws RemoteException
        Initializes the distributed execution framework on the specified device and registers callbacks for notifying the initialization result.

        To enable your application to invoke a component of a non-HarmonyOS application installed on a remote device on the distributed network, you should first call this method to initialize the distributed execution framework on the specified device. If the initialization is successful, your application will be notified through IInitCallback#onInitSuccess(String). If the initialization fails, your application will be notified through IInitCallback#onInitFailure(String, int).

        Parameters:
        deviceId - Indicates the network ID of the device on which the distributed execution framework will be initialized.
        callback - Indicates the callback to be invoked upon a successful or failed initialization attempt.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if argument is null.
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the IPC communication exception happens.
        Since:
        3

      • unInitDistributedEnvironment

        public static void unInitDistributedEnvironment​(String deviceId,
                                                IInitCallback callback)
                                         throws RemoteException
        Deactivates the distributed execution framework on the specified device and unregisters the callback previously registered by calling initDistributedEnvironment(java.lang.String,ohos.distributedschedule.interwork.IInitCallback).

        After this method is called, the application notifies the distributed execution framework that the cross-device is complete and then unregisters the initialization result callback.

        Your application should call this method after the cross-device task is complete.

        Parameters:
        deviceId - Indicates the network ID of the device on which the distributed execution framework will be deactivated.
        callback - Indicates the callback to unregister.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if argument is null.
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if the IPC communication exception happens.
        Since:
        3
